experience.title: Manager, Learning & Development - HR Department
experience.description: 1. Led and coached a team of 4 in establishing organisation-wide L&D initiatives2. Conducted training needs analysis across all departments through interviews and FGDs3. Design and implemented the 70-20-10 model to cultivate continuous employee skill development4. Initiated and facilitated daily 1-on-1 well-being and leadership coaching sessions5. Designed and instituted weekly culture-building, leadership development, and mindfulness group sessions6. Established a coaching and mentoring framework for new employees, benefiting 36 new hires7. Collaborated with the R&D team to design business processes to meet evolving needs8. Orchestrated the recruitment process, onboarding 3 new L&D team members

positions.subtitle: Simple Education Foundation
positions.description: 1. Led the development and implementation of strategic planning and intervention design for the community-parent vertical across five MCD primary schools2. Provided community leadership coaching to school principals and teachers to enhance the parent engagement spaces at schools (School Management Committee & Parent Teacher Meeting)3. Designed and facilitated sessions across 5 schools for parents and educators on "Creating safe school and home environments for children" reaching ~150 families 4. Developed and implemented tools and trackers to strengthen monitoring and evaluation efforts for community vertical interventions5. Managed and coached 3 team members, leading to the promotion of one team member from assistant to associate position6. Contributed to the organization's internal recruitment cycle by designing and evaluating pre-work materials and conducting interviews7. Designed and executed a research study utilizing FGDs and PIs to understand employees' needs better and inform the creation of a robust mental health policy for the organization.
positions.title: Head of Community Engagement, CoE Delhi
positions.description_html:
1. Led the development and implementation of strategic planning and intervention design for the community-parent vertical across five MCD primary schools
2. Provided community leadership coaching to school principals and teachers to enhance the parent engagement spaces at schools (School Management Committee & Parent Teacher Meeting)
3. Designed and facilitated sessions across 5 schools for parents and educators on "Creating safe school and home environments for children" reaching ~150 families
4. Developed and implemented tools and trackers to strengthen monitoring and evaluation efforts for community vertical interventions
5. Managed and coached 3 team members, leading to the promotion of one team member from assistant to associate position
6. Contributed to the organization's internal recruitment cycle by designing and evaluating pre-work materials and conducting interviews
7. Designed and executed a research study utilizing FGDs and PIs to understand employees' needs better and inform the creation of a robust mental health policy for the organization.

positions.subtitle: Simple Education Foundation
positions.description: 1. Designed a year-long School Development Plan (SDP), focused on improving student attendance and foundational literacy and numeracy (FLN) in a blended mode 2. Provided 1O1 leadership coaching to the principal to mobilize collaboration between stakeholders to maintain holistic learning 3. Conducted 1O1 and group digital training for school staff across 6 schools to equip them with online teaching practices and tools4. Provided instructional coaching to 7 teachers, helping them develop independent integrated chapter planning skills and collate online learning resources5. Strategized community development plan for 3 schools to establish strong SMCs and organize objective-driven PTMs6. Led the conceptualization of the organization's vision and philosophy for parent development7. Managed and provided L&D support to 3 team members to build facilitation skills, develop contextual understanding, build and leverage relationships8. Assisted the internal selection committee by reviewing pre-works and conducting interviews
positions.title: Senior Manager, Simple School
positions.description_html:

positions.subtitle: Simple Education Foundation
positions.description: 1. Led the design and execution of SDP incorporating blended approach to improve school functioning and quality of online learning during COVID-192. experience.title: Global Girls Education Fellow
experience.description: The Global Girls' Education Fellowship is a select group of fellows, staff, and alumni of the Teach for All network working together to deepen their understanding and solve global challenges related to girls' education and empowerment.
experience.description_html: The Global Girls' Education Fellowship is a select group of fellows, staff, and alumni of the Teach for All network working together to deepen their understanding and solve global challenges related to girls' education and empowerment. <!---->

experience.title: Fellow
experience.description: 1. Taught science to 208 students (6th & 7th grade) and equipped them with value-based and experiential learning through which students developed the skills and dispositions of presentation, leadership, ownership, respect and grit.2. Developed lesson plans and writing structures with the help of SCERT academic standards (Science) which led to 15% growth in 1.5 years.3. Mentored 9 first-year Teach For India fellows in secondary Science and Social Studies planning, assessment designing, classroom management, art-based curriculum, socio-emotional learning and wellbeing.4. Coordinated CFAG - Art project, a national level project which impacted 205 students from 14 schools across 3 cities (Hyderabad, Chennai and Mumbai), which led to the enhancement of patience, creativity, observation and analytical skills within students.5. Coordinated PARWAAZ, an inter-school indoor games competition where 18 schools from Hyderabad and Secunderabad participated during 2017-19. This led to principals and Teach for India fellows providing a platform for extra-curricular activities to children in their schools.6. Designed and initiated BEST OUT OF WASTE, a solid waste management project which created awareness about solid waste management amongst kids and community people. Also, resulted in the selection of 3 students for National Seminar (Kids Education Revolution) and a student for an International Seminar (CAN Global Summit by Design for Change).7. Raised funds worth 1.2 Lakh through crowdfunding, developed classroom infrastructure, conducted projects for student development and set up a library.8. Worked with parents and kids, educating them about domestic violence, alcoholism, child development and mental health which led to better student outcome and enhanced parents investment.

Taught science to 208 students (6th & 7th grade) and equipped them with value-based and experiential learning through which students developed the skills and dispositions of presentation, leadership, ownership, respect and grit.2. Worked with parents and kids, educating them about domestic violence, alcoholism, child development and mental health which led to better student outcome and enhanced parents investment.

experience.title: Destination Manager

Handled travel queries and did tour operation for Maldives, Singapore, Malaysia, Bali, Thailand, Hongkong, Dubai, Greece, Mauritius, Bhutan and India.3. experience.title: Internship
experience.description: 1. Established relationship with various stakeholders and vendors (previous customers, local industries, tour operators, hotel and transportation service providers).2. Handled queries for domestic travel and helped in preparing itineraries. 3. Collected feedback through telephonic and in-person interview and questionnaire survey from 70 customers. 4. Submitted a report titled “A Study on Customer Satisfaction about Domestic Tourism Packages” to Department of Tourism Studies, Pondicherry University.

publications: [{"title":"Poachers Turned in to Protectors: A case Study On Community Based Ecotourism at Mangalajodi Odisha","subtitle":"International Journal of Economics and Management Science, Pondicherry University","date":"May 5, 2017","description":"Mishra Ajodhya Gourab, Senapati Jyotirmaya & Sarangi Sanjib (2017). Poachers Turned in to Protectors: A case Study On Community Based Ecotourism at Mangalajodi Odisha. International Journal of Economics and Management Science, 3(1), 88-98. ISSN: 2229-4430.Erstwhile local communities of Mangalajodi of Khordha district, Odisha were making their living mostly by catching fishes from the Chilika Lake at Mangalajodi and by illegal poaching of migratory birds. As time passed by, large scale poaching activities resulted in ecological imbalance, biodiversity degradation and with a lot more negative impacts gradually started becoming ardent threat for the future of biodiversity at this Birds Paradise. The alarming scenario gets a kind of rejuvenation with the introduction of ecotourism and related activities at Mangalajodi. This initiation employs almost 100 families of the nearby villages. The poachers eventually turned into protectors of biodiversity. This exploratory research focuses on the process of development of ecotourism at Mangalajodi in a sustainable manner with the participation of various stakeholders such as local communities, Mangalajodi Ecotourism Trust (MET), NGOs like; Indian Grameen Services (IGS), Corporate house like; RBS Foundation India (RBSFI), travel operators, government organizations, tourists etc. at various level. Another major aspect is to figure out various socioeconomic, environmental and other key driving factors influencing local residents in such a remarkable transformation from destructor of the environment to get involved in ecotourism activities. The existing challenges for the sustainable development of community based ecotourism at the destination have also been attempted to hit upon."}]

honors_and_awards.title: Best Coordinator for Akansha'16
honors_and_awards.publication: Department of Tourism Studies, Pondicherry University
honors_and_awards.description: I was being recognised and felicitated as the best coordinator for my outstanding work as a decoration committee coordinator for Akansha'16 fest by the department of tourism studies, Pondicherry University. I was also recognised as an artist by the tourism ministry of Government of Puducherry and given a chance to showcase my art and craftwork at Pondicherry Roa Show'16.
